item.title: Common_verbs
item.author: false
item.description: 가다 = to go 사요 = to buy 팔다 = to sell 오다 = to come 만들다 = to make 보다 = to hear 듣다 = to listen 냄새나다 = to smell 맛보다 = to taste 읽다 = to read 살다 = to live 가르치다 = to teach 걷다 = to walk 뛰다 = to run 열다 = to open 닫다 = to close 울다 = to cry 웃다 = to laugh

item.title: 하다
item.author: false
item.description: Conjugation 하다 = to do 해요 = do 했어요 = did do 할 거예요 = will do 하고 싶어요 = want to do 하고 싶지 않아요 = don’t want to 하겠어요 = going to do it 할 수있어요= can do 할 수 없어요 = cannot do 해야 돼요 = have to do 합시다! = let’s do it 하세요 = do it, please 해 주세요 = please do 하는거 좋아해요 = I like to do.

item.title: 하세요 vs. 해 주세요
item.author: false
item.description: 해 주세요 = Please do this for me. 하세요 = Do this, please. 부탁합니다 = Thank you for agree to do this favor for me. 하세요 is used to order someone to do something. It’s literal translation is “please do” but it’s a very direct way of communicating. In English it would be like saying, “do this…please”. “하세요” is something you might hear when your boss asks you to perform a task.
